result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M. Ulrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--The Court sentences Mr. Ulrich to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $ 705, plus $189 drug abuse surcharge= $894, plus $50 drug testing fee, plus $107.60 summons fee= $1,051.60,  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 5/15/16 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

--The Court orders Mr. Ulrich to comply with DNA sample provision.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case alled at 1:26pm. 
Defendant Chad M. Ulrich in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of the Amended Complaint is admitted. The Court and counsel clarify that in the Amended Criminal Complaint the single Count that applies to Mr. Ulrich is Count #1.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Ulrich to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $ 705, plus $189 drug abuse surcharge= $894, plus $50 drug testing fee, plus $107.60 summons fee= $1,051.60,  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 5/15/16 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court orders Mr. Ulrich to comply with DNA sample provision.
